author: bridge-bot
content:
<eliastzr> I think reasonable would be the ability for evm tooling to display these 3 states to users:
- trusted pending
- mined on l2 
- mined on l1 (+ no forced inclusion or l1 reorg) (re @drortirosh: define "reasonable" ...
for normal use-cases, "received by node" is enough, and usually means it will get included.
but this is something you can't trust, so you do wait for mining, and in many cases, for multiple confirmations, against the less-likely reorgs.
with L2, there is an implicit trust on the sequencer. as long as you trust it, "pending" is strong enough, but if you're paranoid (or doing transactions with really high value), then you'd want to a higher confirmation (namely, inclusion on L1)
And if you're even more paranoid, you should also check the forced-inclusion mechanism of the chain, which bypasses the sequencer (AFAIK, only Arbitrum currently has one, but I might be wrong on that)
So your mileage on "reasonable" varies.)
